description:
The start of the instant opt-in mocks.

I also had to make it so you can turn off animations in CustomButton.

BUG=54833
TEST=none

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=62009

messages.text:
LG

http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1013
File chrome/browser/instant/instant_opt_in.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1013#newcode13
chrome/browser/instant/instant_opt_in.h:13: class InstantOptIn {
If both of these are static why not just have these be functions in the browser namespace?

http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1015
File chrome/browser/views/autocomplete/autocomplete_popup_contents_view.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1015#newcode171
chrome/browser/views/autocomplete/autocomplete_popup_contents_view.h:171: // If non-null the instant opt-in-view is visible.
non-NULL

On Fri, Oct 8, 2010 at 10:04 AM,  <ben@chromium.org> wrote:
> LG
>
>
> http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1013
> File chrome/browser/instant/instant_opt_in.h (right):
>
> http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1013#newcode13
> chrome/browser/instant/instant_opt_in.h:13: class InstantOptIn {
> If both of these are static why not just have these be functions in the
> browser namespace?

I like namespaces better too, but Brett typically tells me to use
classes and if you use namespaces they need to match directories. In
other words the namespace for this file becomes
browser_instant_instant_op_in. UGH!

  -Scott

> http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1015
> File
> chrome/browser/views/autocomplete/autocomplete_popup_contents_view.h
> (right):
>
> http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/diff/2001/1015#newcode171
> chrome/browser/views/autocomplete/autocomplete_popup_contents_view.h:171:
> // If non-null the instant opt-in-view is visible.
> non-NULL
>
> http://codereview.chromium.org/3544015/show
>

Brett says he thinks just having a browser namespace is fine.

-Ben

On Fri, Oct 8, 2010 at 10:19 AM, Scott Violet <sky@chromium.org> wrote:

> classes and if you use namespaces they need to match directories. In
> other words the namespace for this file becomes
> browser_instant_instant_op_in. UGH!

You must be more persuasive than I. namespace it is. I've updated the
patch if you want to take another look.

  -Scott
